articles.title: Astro 3.0 Released: The All-in-One Web Framework
articles.description: An increasingly popular, turbo-charged site generator comfortable with not just static sites, but dynamic and interactive ones too by way of its ‚Äòislands‚Äô approach. You can use React, Vue, Svelte, Solid, and others, with it, and v3 adds View Transitions API support (more on that here) which can result in striking creations like this Spotify 'clone'. It requires a play to really 'get it' but it's great.
articles.author: Astro Team

articles.title: Node.js 20.6 Released with Built-In Support for .env Files
articles.description: The official release post covers everything new in 20.6, but the highlight is support for .env environment files to set environment variables dynamically when a script is run without requiring a third-party library like dotenv.
articles.author: Phil Nash

articles.title: Bye to Rome and Hi to Biome for JS Formatting and Linting
articles.description: First announced in 2020, Rome is/was an ambitious effort to create a unified frontend dev tool to bring ideas from Babel, ESLint, webpack, etc. into one place. After forming a company around Rome and raising money two years ago, things seem to have gone awry, with its key maintainers forking the project as Biome.
articles.author: Emanuele Stoppa and the Biome Team

articles.title: Making Sense of React Server Components
articles.description: This is fantastic and exactly what it says on the tin, ‚Äì we'll be focusing on it more in next week's React Status newsletter though üòâ
articles.author: Josh W Comeau

articles.title: You Don't Need to Learn Svelte ‚Äì Here's Why
articles.description: I mean.. you kinda do, but Kavii‚Äôs excitement is infectious and Svelte‚Äôs approach remains refreshing.
articles.author: Kavii Suri

articles.title: item:¬†Using Labeled Loops in JavaScript
articles.description: If using labels gives you flashbacks to BASIC and GOTO statements, I sympathize, but in JavaScript, labels open up an interesting control flow technique. More about this on MDN. continue item;
articles.author: Ben Nadel

articles.title: A Wide View of Automated Testing in React Apps
articles.description: A straightforward and to the point introduction to why you might use automated testing, how to get going in the scope of a React app, and what to be testing.
articles.author: The React Handbook

articles.title: How to Create a Dual-Mode Cross-Runtime JavaScript Package
articles.description: Specifically, supporting both ESM and CommonJS, and across runtimes like Node, Deno and the browser.
articles.author: Hexagon

articles.title: Benchmarking 24 CSV Parsing Approaches
articles.description: The most extensive CSV parsing benchmark I‚Äôve seen. The author is himself the creator of the ŒºDSV CSV parsing library and wanted to check out the common ‚Äòlightning fast performance‚Äô claims of other libaries.
articles.author: Leon Sorokin

articles.title: The Complexity of Building an Efficient Node.js Docker Image
articles.description: It‚Äôs possible to get huge reductions in image size and build time and Samuel shares his approach here, but he also questions whether all this work should be necessary.
articles.author: Samuel Bodin

articles.title: Peaks.js 3.0: View and Interact with Audio Waveforms
articles.description: A JavaScript component for browser-based audio waveform visualization that comes from the BBC‚Äôs R&D department. There‚Äôs a live example on the homepage. GitHub repo.
articles.author: BBC

articles.title: üé∏¬†SVGuitar: Create SVG-Based Guitar Chord Charts
articles.description: Why not continue with the musical theme? üòÅ You can experiment with this one via this live demo.
articles.author: Raphael Voellmy

articles.title: FormKit 1.0: The Open-Source Form Framework for Vue
articles.description: Ships with production-ready scaffolding like inputs, forms, submission and error handling, and validation rules.
articles.author: FormKit, Inc.

articles.title: Plate: Roll Your Own Slate-Based Rich-Text Editor
articles.description: A framework for building React-based rich text editors where you can select the specific features and functionality you need. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Ziad Beyens

articles.title: Math.js: An Extensive Math Library for Node and Browser
articles.description: Work with complex numbers, fractions, units, matrices, symbolic computation, etc. A long standing library now, but continuing to get frequent updates. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Jos de Jong

articles.title: Calendar.js: A Calendar Control with Drag and Drop
articles.description: A responsive calendar with no dependencies, full drag and drop support (even between calendars) and many ways to manage events with recurring events, exporting, holidays, and more.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.description: Version 1.0 of Bun, the notably fast JavaScriptCore-based JS runtime, is due to launch in the coming hours. There's a livestream and, we assume, a launch post due to land here very soon.
In other 'alternative runtime news', the Deno team has announced native npm support on its Deno Deploy platform. They've also announced Deno KV is in open beta.
Mozilla: "Over the course of the year Firefox has improved by around 40% on the Vue.js benchmark" ‚Äì find out why.

David Heinemeier Hansson, the creator of Ruby on Rails, announced that they're dropping TypeScript from Turbo (a library commonly used with Rails) in favor of plain old JavaScript. Social media drama ensued.

What's going on with the Gatsby React framework? Folks are noticing there's not a lot going on with it lately and that üê¶ Netlify layoffs had a big impact. Netlify does, however, say üê¶ updates are coming.
GitHub has made changes to its homepage feeds. Quite a few people are unhappy about it, though.
"The CSS-in-JS sector has plateaued," says the latest State of CSS survey.
What's new in Svelte as of September 2023? Quite a lot.
TypeScript 5.2 ‚Äì Complete with the much awaited using declarations..
Node-RED 3.1 ‚Äì The powerful low-code/visual programming environment gets some key improvements in its editor.
jq 1.7 ‚Äì It's not JavaScript, but surely the best JSON processing tool to exist.
Ky 1.0 ‚Äì Simple HTTP client based upon Fetch for browsers, Node & Deno.
jQuery 3.7.1 ‚Äì Oh yes indeedy üéâ
Cypress 13

articles.title: Astro 3.0 Released
articles.description: This new version of popular web framework / site generation system Astro claims to be amongst the first to support the View Transitions API ‚Äî making transitions possible without rolling out a SPA. This release also includes image optimization improvements, optimized built outputs, and more. Repo here.
articles.author: Astro

articles.title: Browse Websites by What Fonts They Use
articles.description: If you‚Äôre looking for inspiration or the ways in which a particular font has been used, this is a handy resource.
articles.author: Bertrand Bruandet

articles.title: A Review of Browser Video Players
articles.description: Browsers each provide built-in video players for the <video> element. Here, Adrian runs some tests to see how they compare from an accessibility point of view.
articles.author: Adrian Roselli

articles.title: How Layout Position Impacts Three Big Web Performance Levers
articles.description: An interesting performance study from Shopify that looked at three common issues that impact on layout position ‚Äî namely lazy loading images above the fold, asynchronous loading of CSS needed for elements above the fold, and not prioritizing the fetch of the the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) image.
articles.author: Sia Karamalegos (Shopify)

articles.title: Laying Out Dots on Dice using display:flex & Pseudo¬†Classes
articles.description: A neat problem to solve here: How to display the proper number of dots on the faces of dice.
articles.author: Maciek Fitzner

articles.title: Towards HTTPS by Default
articles.description: Chrome is expanding its ‚ÄòHTTPS-First Mode‚Äô in an effort to help keep safe users who run into the ‚Äústubborn 5-10% of traffic‚Äù that has remained on HTTP.
articles.author: Joe DeBlasio (Google)

articles.title: Where to Put Focus When Deleting a Thing
articles.description: When deleting something Adrian notes that you should ‚Äúgenerally move focus to the prior equivalent control or its grouping container‚Äù.
articles.author: Adrian Roselli

articles.title: Why Does Email Development Have to Suck?
articles.description: A relatable explainer on why things are the way they are when it comes to email and what things can help ease the pain.
articles.author: Hristiyan Dodov

articles.title: Adapting Illustrations to Dark Mode
articles.description: Shares a quick way to make any illustrations on your site look good in both light and dark mode.
articles.author: Simon Farshid

articles.title: UI Skeleton Gallery: SVG Loader UI Elements for Design Wireframes & Mockups
articles.description: As explained in the FAQ, ‚ÄúA skeleton element is a UI element or screen that doesn‚Äôt contain actual content but instead offers a low-fidelity page wireframe before content completely loads.‚Äù
articles.author: BrandBird

articles.title: tw2panda: An Online Tool and CLI to Migrate Code from Tailwind to Panda CSS
articles.description: Panda is a type-safe CSS-in-JS solution we featured a few months back. You can try the online tool here or install locally to use the CLI. Also offers a VS Code extension.
articles.author: Alexandre Stahmer

articles.title: üé∏¬†SVGuitar: Create SVG-Based Guitar Chord Charts
articles.description: You can experiment with it in this live demo.
articles.author: Raphael Voellmy

articles.title: Video Thumbnail API: Get Thumbnail Images from Public Video¬†URLs
articles.description: Enter a public video URL along with a time in seconds to grab a thumbnail at the closest frame. Also usable via a GET request using the API.
articles.author: Tim Bennetto

articles.title: SVG Shapes: A Collection of 100+ Customizable SVG Shapes
articles.description: Choose any shape in the gallery then customize the color using a solid fill or gradient of your choice.
articles.author: Anup Aglawe

articles.description: Notable accessiblity advocate and inclusive design expert Molly Holzschlag, sometimes called 'the fairy godmother of the web', has died aged 60. She was a force for good for the open web and will be much missed.
The Web Preferences API is being prototyped. Bramus explains why it matters.
The first public working draft for the CSS Transitions Level 2 spec is now live.
Firefox, as of version 117, now has automatic translation, a la Chrome.
In other browser news, Chrome is pushing ahead with its not-exactly-much-loved new way to target ads at users based on their browser history.

If you use QR codes anyway, be careful and check where they actually point to.. otherwise you could üìÑ have to recall several physical products (PDF) for containing QR codes pointing to offensive web sites.. üôà
